title: be/bei in Tanru
goal: Use be/bei to specify tanru components.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

be'o review:

The seller of books, who is big → ?
The seller of books which are big → ?

(Answers: lo vecnu be lo cukta be'o poi barda, lo vecnu be lo cukta poi barda)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
karni x1 is a journal/periodical with content x2 journal/periodical
datni x1 is data/information about x2 data/information

Tanru with be

In tanru, you can use be to specify which component takes which place:

lo skami pilno

A computer user. — But user of WHAT computer?

lo skami be la .ibm. pilno

An IBM-computer user.

Which Part Gets be?

be attaches to the selbri immediately before it:

lo barda gerku ponse

A big-dog owner.

lo barda be li 100 gerku ponse

A big-by-100 dog owner.

Complex Example

lo cukta vecnu be lo pemci

A book-seller of poems.

Wait — does this mean seller-of-poems who sells books? Or book-seller who deals in poems?

To be clearer:

lo vecnu be lo pemci cukta

A poem-seller book. (odd)

lo cukta be lo pemci vecnu

A poem-book seller.

Key Point

In tanru, be attaches to the immediately preceding selbri. Be careful about which word gets the place.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Tanru with be

Translate:

  1. A Lojban speaker (speaker of Lojban who talks).
  2. A book reader of poems.
  3. A computer user of games.
Answers
  1. lo tavla be la .jbobau.
  2. lo cukta tcidu be lo pemci or lo tcidu be lo pemci cukta
  3. lo skami pilno be lo kelci

Exercise 2: Clarifying Tanru

What do these mean?

  1. lo vecnu be lo cukta
  2. lo cukta vecnu
  3. lo vecnu be lo cukta be'o poi barda
Answers
  1. The seller of books
  2. A book-seller (book-type seller)
  3. The seller of books, who is big

Exercise 3: New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is a journal.
  2. I read data.
  3. The data is new.
Answers
  1. ti karni
  2. mi tcidu lo datni
  3. lo datni cu cnino

items.text: A Lojban speaker (speaker of Lojban who talks).

items.answer: `lo cukta tcidu be lo pemci` or `lo tcidu be lo pemci cukta`

items.text: `lo vecnu be lo cukta be'o poi barda`
items.answer: The seller of books, who is big

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "A speaker of Lojban." → lo tavla be la .jbobau.
  2. "This is a journal." → ti karni
  3. "The data about books." → lo datni be lo cukta

Today's Vocab

Lojban English
karni journal/periodical
datni data/information

Grammar:

be in tanru:

  • be attaches to the selbri directly before it
  • Use for clarity in complex tanru

Summary

You learned to use be/bei in tanru to clarify which component takes which place.
